intro: Argostemma acutum, commonly known as the sharpleaf argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Argostemma acutum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
